item.title: When Java's WatchService is not the right tool in a container
item.author: brice.dutheil@gmail.com (Brice Dutheil)
item.description: Boring code that should be written once and run everywhere Suppose the application you’re working on needs to monitor changes to a file and rely on Java’s WatchService introduced in Java 7.
